title: (x) "Edge of the City" poster type (Saul Bass) - Trade Gothic {Lex}
content:
Can anyone help me identify this one? It’s from a Saul Bass poster from ’57.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080626112041im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/edge_5110.gif)

 [‹ (x) "Before the Sun Rises" book cover - Troover (Trooper) {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080626112041/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20073 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Looking for the font "Deadwood" - Psy/Ops {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080626112041/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20064 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kiarostami

comments.content:
Helvetica Compressed, or maybe Trade Gothic Condensed? I’ll check.

- Lex

[Trade Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080626112041/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.108133.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=EDGE+OF+THE+CITY&sampleSize=48) seems to be the closest I can find. Maybe someone else can find something closer.

- Lex
It’s certainly close, but the “g” isn’t right.

I’d say Trade… the G doesn’t look like Helvetica.

Trade Gothic LT Std Bold Condensed No. 20
